tokens.t: Then Job answered and said,

verses.plain: Even to day is my complaint bitter: my stroke is heavier than my groaning.

tokens.t: Even to day
my complaint bitter: my stroke is heavier than my groaning.

verses.plain: Oh that I knew where I might find him! that I might come even to his seat!

tokens.t: Oh that I knew where I might find him!
I might come
to his seat!

verses.plain: I would order my cause before him, and fill my mouth with arguments.

tokens.t: I would order
cause before him, and fill my mouth with arguments.

verses.plain: I would know the words which he would answer me, and understand what he would say unto me.

tokens.t: I would know the words
he would answer me, and understand what he would say unto me.

verses.plain: Will he plead against me with his great power? No; but he would put strength in me.

tokens.t: Will he plead against me with
great power? No; but he would put
in me.

verses.plain: There the righteous might dispute with him; so should I be delivered for ever from my judge.

tokens.t: There the righteous might dispute with him; so should I be delivered for ever from my judge.

verses.plain: Behold, I go forward, but he is not there; and backward, but I cannot perceive him:

tokens.t: Behold, I go forward, but he
not
and backward, but I cannot perceive him:

verses.plain: On the left hand, where he doth work, but I cannot behold him: he hideth himself on the right hand, that I cannot see him:

tokens.t: On the left hand, where he doth work, but I cannot behold
he hideth himself on the right hand, that I cannot see

verses.plain: But he knoweth the way that I take: when he hath tried me, I shall come forth as gold.

tokens.t: But he knoweth the way that I take:
he hath tried me, I shall come forth as gold.

verses.plain: My foot hath held his steps, his way have I kept, and not declined.

tokens.t: My foot hath held his steps, his way have I kept, and not declined.

verses.plain: Neither have I gone back from the commandment of his lips; I have esteemed the words of his mouth more than my necessary food.

tokens.t: Neither have I gone back from the commandment of his lips; I have esteemed the words of his mouth more than my necessary

verses.plain: But he is in one mind, and who can turn him? and what his soul desireth, even that he doeth.

tokens.t: But he
in one
, and who can turn him? and
his soul desireth, even
he doeth.

verses.plain: For he performeth the thing that is appointed for me: and many such things are with him.

tokens.t: For he performeth
appointed for me: and many such
with him.

verses.plain: Therefore am I troubled at his presence: when I consider, I am afraid of him.

tokens.t: Therefore am I troubled at his presence: when I consider, I am afraid of him.

verses.plain: For God maketh my heart soft, and the Almighty troubleth me:

tokens.t: For God maketh my heart soft, and the Almighty troubleth me:

verses.plain: Because I was not cut off before the darkness, neither hath he covered the darkness from my face.

tokens.t: Because I was not cut off before the darkness,
hath he covered the darkness from my face.

footnotes.text: that…: Heb. that is with me
esteemed: Heb. hid, or, laid up
